questions.body: Concussion statistics:

answers.body: Are very accurate because athletes always report their symptoms
Are accurate because 4 out of 5 patients present to their primary care doctors rather than the Emergency department
Are accurate because athletes don’t want to let down their teammate
Are not accurate because athletes don’t realize a concussion was sustained

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Studies show that athletes may not report symptoms
Since the 1990s, emergency department visits for sports-related traumatic brain injury have:
The number of reported concussions varies because:

answers.body: Different definitions used in different research projects
Lack of a widespread injury surveillance system
Different entry points for athletes with concussion into the healthcare system

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Concussion rates vary between studies because of over-reporting
Why do the number of concussions reported annually vary?

answers.body: Different definitions used in different research projects
Concussions are only recorded in the Emergency Room
Different definitions used in different research projects and under-reporting of injury

questions.body: Athletes do not report concussion symptoms because they:

answers.body: Did not think a concussion was serious enough to report
Did not realize a concussion was sustained
Did not think a concussion was serious enough to report and did not realize a concussion was sustained

questions.body: Because athletes don’t want to let their teammates down, they:

answers.body: Always report concussion symptoms right away
May report their symptoms after a game has finished
May not report concussion symptoms and may report their symptoms after a game has finished

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Most athletes with concussion present to an emergency department
The most common reason athletes did not report a concussion is they:

answers.body: Did not realize a concussion was sustained
Did not want to leave the game
Did not want to let down their teammates
Did not think a concussion was serious enough to report

questions.body: Where do most suspected concussions seek evaluation?:
TRUE or FALSE: Concussion rates have decreased since the 1990s
Studies show what percentage of athletes may not report symptoms of concussion:
Under-reporting of concussion symptoms:

answers.body: Occurs rarely as athletes know the signs and symptoms of concussions
Occurs rarely because coaches encourage symptom reporting
Occurs commonly because athletes wanted to come out of the game
Occurs commonly because athletes did not think symptoms were serious enough to report

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Concussion symptom reporting rates can potentially improve with athlete education and coaches creating a supportive environment
TRUE or FALSE: All concussions involve a loss of consciousness
TRUE or FALSE: A concussion can occur from a quick movement of the head without trauma to the head
TRUE or FALSE: A concussion is defined as bleeding in the brain
By definition, concussions:

answers.body: Are a severe traumatic brain injury

questions.body: An athlete comes to the sideline reporting he got his “bell rung”, as the coach:

answers.body: Put him right back in the game
Wait until the athlete reports he feels ok and send them back to play
Hold him out for further medical evaluation as this is a suspected concussion
Tell him not to worry, it’s no big deal, you had lots of those when you played youth sports

questions.body: Concussions:

answers.body: Usually demonstrate symptoms right away, within a few minutes during practice/game
Sometimes have a delayed presentation such that symptoms are recognized 2-3 days later when returning to school
May not demonstrate symptoms until months later
Usually demonstrate symptoms right away, within a few minutes during practice/game and sometimes have a delayed presentation such that symptoms are recognized

questions.body: Concussion occur LEAST commonly in:
Concussion occur MOST commonly in:
TRUE or FALSE: All suspected head injuries require imaging (CT, MRI)
If imaging of the brain (CT or MRI) is performed for an isolated concussion:

answers.body: Imaging will demonstrate swelling in the brain
Imaging will demonstrate a structural problem

questions.body: What percentage of pediatric patients with concussion will be better in 3-4 weeks?
TRUE or FALSE: A concussion is a functional problem such that nerve cells are temporarily not working well
Concussions can occur in which of the following way/s?

answers.body: Head to head collision with a helmet on
Shoulder-to-shoulder collision leading to quick movement of the head without head impact

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Concussions can occur without any impact to the head
Concussion rates are highest in:
The most common concussion symptom is:
Young athletes who sustain a head injury:

answers.body: Always tell you they have a headache
Sometimes may grab their head instead of telling you they have a headache

questions.body: All of the following are symptoms of concussion except:

answers.body: Reporting that the lights are too bright

questions.body: Vomiting:

answers.body: Can occur with concussion and more serious injuries
Always indicates bleeding in the brain
Can be a sign of more serious injury
Vomiting is never something to worry about
Can occur with concussion and more serious injuries and can be a sign of more serious injury

questions.body: The following symptoms are all cognitive symptoms of concussion EXCEPT:

answers.body: Not able to move the arm

questions.body: TRUE OR FALSE: Loss of consciousness occurs in all concussions
A possible concussion may have occurred if there was a head trauma or quick movement of the head and symptoms of:

answers.body: Feeling slowed down and difficulty with school

questions.body: Cognitive symptoms, like difficulty concentrating:

answers.body: Are always noticed at the time of injury
Sometimes are not noted until athletes return to the classroom a day or two later
Always occur later that night on the day of injury

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Concussions can cause emotional lability (feeling more emotional ups and downs)
Which of the following symptoms can be seen in athletes with a concussion:
After sustaining a hit during a game, an athlete is crying uncontrollable but not complaining any pain:

answers.body: This athlete is being a wimp
This athlete is trying to get out of going back into the game
This could be the sign of a concussion

questions.body: After a concussion, athletes may be:
TRUE or FALSE: A common symptom of concussion is drowsiness

video.title: What to Do? Primary Care Protocol

questions.body: 15 year-old volleyball player takes a little extra time coming up after a collision with another teammate and looks a little off balance. She staggers to the side of the court. She’s conscious but confused. You:

answers.body: Send to the locker room to wait for the team to finish the game
Reassure her and send her back in the game
Hold out of play for sideline evaluation and await medical clearance before return to play

questions.body: What do you do if your athlete displays any signs of concussion:

answers.body: Given some encouragement and send back in the game
Rest a few minutes and then send back into the game
Contact family and await medical clearance before return to play
If in doubt, sit out and contact family and await medical clearance before return to play

questions.body: TRUE OR FALSE: The concussion laws across the country prohibit same day return to play.

video.title: What to Do? Emergency Care Protocol

questions.body: What do you recommend for your athlete is you notice seizure activity, multiple vomiting episodes or limb weakness:

answers.body: Go to the locker room until the end of the day
See your primary care doctor in 2-3 days
Immediately go to the Emergency Room

questions.body: All of the following symptoms and signs would warrant referral to an Emergency Room immediately EXCEPT:

answers.body: One pupil larger than the other

questions.body: Which of the following symptoms would be reason to go to an Emergency Room immediately:

answers.body: Seizure and multiple episodes of vomiting

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: All athletes who sustain a head injury must be seen in the Emergency Room
Which of the following symptom sets would be appropriate to recommend followup with a medical provider in a few days:

answers.body: Forgetting what happened around the time of injury, multiple episodes of vomiting and headache
Sensitivity to light and sound, irritability and unable to move limbs
Dizzy, confused and had a seizure
Forgetting what happened around the time of injury, multiple episodes of vomiting and headache

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Forgetting what happened around the time of injury requires Emergency Room evaluation

video.title: What to Do? Dos and Don'ts

questions.body: Call 911 and don’t move an athlete if:

answers.body: Complaining of numbness, tingling or weakness

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: After a head injury sending an athlete to the locker room alone is a good plan
If an athlete is suspected to have a concussion, do the following EXCEPT:

answers.body: Monitor the athlete or assign a reliable person to stay with them
Encourage follow-up with a medical provider
Reassure they will definitely return to play in 7 days

questions.body: After a concussion, you can support your athlete by all the following EXCEPT:

answers.body: Reassuring them the symptoms will resolve with the correct support
Balance may be off in the first 7-10 days but is expected to improve
Explaining that 70% of concussions resolve within 3-4 weeks
Telling them they may always have some cognitive deficits

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: A head injury cannot be considered a concussion unless a person loses consciousness
What percent of people with concussions lose consciousness?
TRUE or FALSE: Athletes who come out of play immediately when symptoms are noted after a head trauma miss less practice
Athletes who did not immediately report concussion symptoms after a head trauma and continued to play:

answers.body: Recovered more quickly than those who came out of play right away
Missed 5 more practice days than those who came out of play right away
Had a more prolonged recovery time than those who came out of play right away
Recovered more quickly than those who came out of play right away and missed 5 more practice days than those who came out of play right away
Missed 5 more practice days than those who came out of play right away and had a more prolonged recovery time than those who came out of play right away

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Complete rest is beneficial to making concussion recovery fastest
TRUE or FALSE: After a concussion, recovery is based on finding the balance between rest and activity that does not worsen symptoms or lead to repeat head injury
Five keys to concussion recovery include all EXCEPT:
Concussion recovery is best when it involves:

answers.body: Gradual return to learn and physical activity

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Sleep can help to facilitate recovery
Part of a concussion recovery play should include all of the following EXCEPT:

answers.body: Napping all day and interrupting normal night time sleep

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: To facilitate concussion recovery, athletes can take naps as long as they do not interfere with nighttime sleep

video.title: Post Concussion: Eat Well, Drink Well

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: There is no magic food or drink for concussion recovery
To help facilitate recovery from concussion, athletes can be encouraged to:
TRUE or FALSE: Staying home from school for 5 days after a concussion is recommended
Tips you can give to your athletes regarding school after a concussion include:

answers.body: It’s better to just miss a lot of days of school than try to go back for partial days
Don’t worry about getting behind; anxiety/stress can slow recovery

questions.body: When returning to school:

answers.body: Start with full days without accommodations
Take all tests and complete all assignments
Do all computer work and screen time activities even if it increases symptoms
Begin with partial days and gradually increase

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Strict brain rest has detrimental effects on patients
To facilitate return to learn:

answers.body: Keep disruptions of routine to a minimum
Return the recovering student to school with accommodation as soon as possible
Engage the family, medical team, academic team and school athletic team in the return to school plan

questions.body: After a concussion:

answers.body: There are no limits on screen time
Video games are fine as long as they are done on a tv/console
Watching TV on a regular television is fine

questions.body: After a suspected concussion, smart phones:

answers.body: Should not be used at all until cleared
Can be used for video games
Should not be used at all until cleared and can be used for video games
May be used in moderation to communicate with and remain socially connected

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: After a concussion, an athlete should undergo complete physical and cognitive rest until symptoms resolve
Early physical activity after a concussion is:

answers.body: May be implemented while athletes still have symptoms
Dangerous and may prolong recovery and may be implemented while athletes still have symptoms
Safe, better than rest alone, and may be implemented while athletes still have symptoms

questions.body: When beginning the return to play program:

answers.body: Athletes may advance to the next step 24 hours after the previous if no increase or recurrence in symptoms
All symptoms must be resolved and stop activity if symptoms increase
Stop activity if symptoms increase and athletes may advance to the next step 24 hours after the previous if no increase or recurrence in symptoms

questions.body: Non-contact activity includes all the following EXCEPT:

answers.body: Hitting a ball from a tee

questions.body: All of the following can be done as part of non-contact training EXCEPT:
TRUE or FALSE: During the gradual return to play program, activities that increase the heart rate are prohibited
Before participation in contact practice, athletes must:

answers.body: Able to perform all non-contact activity without recurrence of symptoms
Cleared by a physician trained in concussion-management

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: Before participating in a game, athletes must complete a contact practice without symptoms
TRUE or FALSE: CT and MRI studies should be done for all athletes after a concussion
CT scans are recommended:

answers.body: For all patients with suspected concussions
Never; radiation exposure is too high
If athletes go to the Emergency Department
If athletes demonstrate multiple episodes of vomiting, severe, worsening headache and/or other symptoms that could indicate bleeding or fracture

questions.body: TRUE or FALSE: CT and MRI are expected to be normal in an isolated concussion
Head CTs are considered to evaluate for all the following EXCEPT:
TRUE or FALSE: MRIs are usually done if concussion symptoms persist more than 3-4 weeks to evaluate for an underlying issue
